meanings.definition: To walk a long distance, especially over rough terrain, on foot.
meanings.sent1: We had to footslog through the forest to reach the campsite.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers had to footslog for miles carrying heavy packs.
meanings.sent3: After footslogging all day, we finally arrived at the top of the mountain.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was footslogging through a never-ending swamp of paperwork.
meanings.sent5: The image of footslogging through the desert heat stayed with him for years.

meanings.definition: A long, tiring walk, especially over rough terrain.
meanings.sent1: The footslog up the steep hill was exhausting but rewarding.
meanings.sent2: She embarked on a challenging footslog through the rocky valley.
meanings.sent3: The footslog turned into a fun adventure when they found a hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent4: The footslog through the snow felt like a journey through a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the footslog along the rugged coast lingered in her mind.
